Can we get some info on the team behind this?  Who is your CTO? What kind of experience does he have running an exchange? How many people on the dev team?  How will you make sure your exchange does not get hacked? Security is the #1 issue for exchanges.  Any exchange whitepaper I've seen has this info. I'm very interested, but not having this info in your whitepaper makes me a little bit cautious.   Security is our top priority for WCX. Our directors are custodians of customer funds and it's important to disclose their identities to the public responsibly without putting client funds or their personal safety at risk. This in itself is a security feature.  This is why we're working with widely recognized and trusted escrows and partners for now, with which we've shared information about us in confidence.  Some other security features: 98% of funds are stored in cold storage (multi-sig when supported, distributed geographically); 2FA (both phone and email); full encryption; segregated backend infrastructure; DDOS mitigation umbrella; independent third-party security audits.

Author: Macht
Title: [ANN][ICO] WCX – Digital currency exchange built by ex Apple engineers
Body: I see. Well, I'm not here to tell anyone what to do. I'm stating my opinion and in this case, it's a very strong one because it angers me. Yes also because I think it's wrong and I hate it if people are treated like that, but mostly because realizing it's a scam just destroys my dreams. This is the second scam I have stumbled upon in less than a week and I'm not even searching for them. When I heard of this ICO I was so pumped because this is exactly what I would love to buy into, and also something I understand, because I have used a lot of exchanges, and most of them have a lot to improve imo. So I did my due diligence, or so I thought. I was about to push the button and send a huge amount to the address I was given because I feared I would lose the spot. I'm glad I was able to step back from it and convince myself to sleep over it. The next day I realised that I hadn't done ANY due diligence, because there was nothing to check and judge. There's no tangible information whatsoever. I've spent more time researching it and at some point I couldn't pretend anymore that it was legit. At least, I don't think so. I'm not happy about it, because if their calculations were right, the amount I was about to invest would have given me enough passive income for a long time, if not for the rest of my life.  Imo, it's just too good to be true.

Author: spleeky
Title: [ANN][ICO] WCX – Digital currency exchange built by ex Apple engineers
Body: I also applied for the presale, was accepted and was given a 24 hour deadline. I then asked per email if they could give me informations about the escrow, I thought that should be very standard. They replied that they dont have a well known escrow, wouldnt tell me anything about the escrow and said they will have a well known one very soon.... .  Correct me if Im wrong but as far as I know the whole reason to have an escrow and the principle behind it is that 2 parties use a person or an organisation/entity that is known to both, is independent and has a high reputation and is very trustworthy.  How can you say we use an escrow and then give me a random unknonw BTC adress that could belong to anyone without giving me any info about who the escrow is  Thats it for me, Im def. not investing considering all the unknowns in this project.  If they are legit, so be it, I gladly loose the discount for the presale and buy later because I like the idea but the risk outweighs the benefits imo at this point by far.

Author: thaytch
Title: [ANN][ICO] WCX – Digital currency exchange built by ex Apple engineers
Body: How come WCX haven't answered my question?  You guys need to wake up. WCX sell a token that will share future profits with its holders. This means that they are selling UNREGISTERED securities to you people. That's the reason why they are so secretive about their operations as well because this is a fraud. They are not allowed to sell such securities to unaccredited investors, yet they are happily taking your money.  They are trying to circumvent this by excluding U.S investors yet they fail to realise that other countries have strict security laws too.  Wake up people... This is nothing more than a quick money grab.

Author: thaytch
Title: [ANN][ICO] WCX – Digital currency exchange built by ex Apple engineers
Body: It doesn't matter whether they announce it or not. If you share profits with owners of a token, it's a security. It's as easy as that. If you don't register securities and sell them to unaccredited investors, you will get caught eventually.  You are also lying that other countries don't have similar strict security laws. Germany has a very similar "Aktiengesetz" (securities law) in place that came into effect in 1937, 3 years after the SEC was founded in the U.S.  I am just trying to warn people that projects like these that sell unregistered securities are ticking time bombs. If you are in here to flip it, that's ok. If you are here because you think of this as a serious long-term investment, you should think twice about it.

So for everybody else, again, be careful and don't invest unless they reveal a minimum of information, atm they provide us with nothing. Author: polkacoin
Title: [ANN][ICO] WCX – Digital currency exchange built by ex Apple engineers
Body: Revealing private key holding team members will only make the exchange less secure. This has been explained a million times in the replies in this thread. If you don't want to invest in the pre-sale you can simply wait till the exchange launches before the ICO then decide.  As far as legitimacy, and as far as I've been dealing with the WCX team and pretty much everyone on this thread, they have delivered on all their promises so far. They are following their business timeline and the dates have been announced for beta, ICO, launch etc. so it's fair I think to let them do it.  I think the thinking behind the Presale is you take on a little more risk and get large bonuses. By the time the exchange launches all the information will be public and I *personally* believe buying WCXT will be a no-brainer.

Author: Joking313
Title: [ANN][ICO] WCX – Digital currency exchange built by ex Apple engineers
Body: How dense are you people? I mean really i don't want to be an asshole but it is like you people put 0 brain power into thinking these things though.  Most ICOs have no problem revealing their team because the crypto they hold is theirs, if they lose it it is their own fault.  On exchanges they hold not only their own but all of their clients too, which means that not only do they have vastly more crypto but it is not their own, and losing customer funds would result in a lot of mistrust for the exchange and loss of clients.

Author: polkacoin
Title: [ANN][ICO] WCX – Digital currency exchange built by ex Apple engineers
Body: Well-said, hopefully newbies will start to understand... As a person who lives and breathes security, I know private key holder identity is a very big deal for an exchange. Deciding whether or not to reveal them should be taken very seriously (I opt to keep them non-public and instead generate trust through the product / customer service).

Author: Macht
Title: [ANN][ICO] WCX – Digital currency exchange built by ex Apple engineers
Body: What is this supposed to mean, some kind of insult? I see you are already identifying yourself with these people, feeling threatened whenever someone asks serious questions. Same goes for you, polka. I've read everything as you suggested, and they explain NOTHING.  So for everybody else who thinks about pre-ordering. There is no need to keep the team a secret just to secure the private keys. If you are doing serious business, you will find better ways to keep them secure than not saying ANYTHING about your team. It's a stupid argument and smells fishy. And to argue "this is crypto" and the keys could easily be stolen is just stupid. BECAUSE this is crypto, a single person doesn't matter at all for the funds. If they are serious about security, they will do multisig anyways.  The whitepaper is a joke, it has nothing to do with what most crypto projects consider a whitepaper. It's just marketing speak, more like a flyer, not even a small business plan. They won't tell you anything, not even the name of the company. There is NO ESCROW whatsoever, which means if they run with the money, it's gone. And you won't be able to complain to anyone other than some anonymous nicknames on this forum.  The bitcointalk forum used to be very sceptical, but it seems as soon as someone opens their digital purse, the greed takes over and people stop questioning the most basic things. Just don't invest anything in the presale.

Author: polkacoin
Title: [ANN][ICO] WCX – Digital currency exchange built by ex Apple engineers
Body: Look at this dumbass coming to lecture me about security. It's not about 1 person fool even if they are the entire team, if they get to 1 person they can get to the rest. Plus multisig has almost zero provable advantage over hot / cold structure, just ask bitfinex who got hacked for $200MM they were using multisig.  There is no reason to reveal team member identities. It only serves to put customer funds at risk. It doesn't even increase trust or security. Look at bitfinex their team is "supposedly" known identities, they got hacked like dogs for hundreds of $MM. It's just foolish from security perspective to reveal the private holder identity.  On the flip side Poloniex has unknown owners and they been running without a single hack for years... Also may I say they are the largest exchange by volume...

Author: wcxofficial
Title: [ANN][ICO] WCX – Digital currency exchange built by ex Apple engineers
Body: Hello all,  Thank you for your continued support! Here are a few updates from the past couple of days.  → WCX just launched its ICO Presale, where you can purchase WCXT with a 15% bonus using BTC, ETH, LTC, DASH, and USDT. The current minimum purchase is 250,000 WCXT and this minimum is reduced every week until the Presale tokens are sold out.  → The referral program is back! And better than ever. For every friend you refer, you get 50 WCXT + 5% of the WCXT they buy, and they get an extra 15% bonus when they buy WCXT. You can get your referral link by signing up on WCX.  → The new translation project for the ICO Presale site is up on POEditor. You can join our translator community here.  → WCX Slack just launched. Slack channel will be relaunched with the Beta on Sep 1.   ---     Please reach out to hello@wcex.co for assistance.  Quote from: SL HE on August 16, 2017, 12:05:26 PM Referral links is not working   Instead of https://_wcex.co/?ref=bla_bla_bla my browser converts this string to https://_wcex.co/?ref=bla_bla_bla?ref=bla_bla_bla in address bar, as it was when the referral program was turned off. Tell me please when refferral links they will be working? Thanks.  This should be fixed.  Quote from: gintrux on August 16, 2017, 12:51:38 PM 1. I read on your website If your WCX tokens are held outside of WCX itself, you'll be able to provide an ETH address on your account that we'll monitor when making payments to you. tell me more how can the tokens be transferred from one wallet to another, or e.g. from wcx wallet to my own custom wallet.  2. Is there a way to transfer WCXT tokens to another wallet without going through the exchange?  3. When someone signs up through my referral link, do they also get 50 WCXT?  4. Is there a way to get monthly payment in bitcoins only? E.g. some coins that you collect fees on might be going down, so by the time monthly payment time comes, they might lose most of the value. It would be great if there was a way to auto-exchange them to bitcoin at the time they are collected as a fee. Or when some fee balance of that coin gets reached.  1. WCXT are ERC20 tokens so they can be held in any Ethereum wallet.  2. At the end of the ICO, you can transfer the WCXT from your WCX account directly to another wallet without needing to use the exchange.  3. Yes as long as they verify their email.  4. This is an interesting idea that has not yet been implemented. Payments to you are made in the digital currencies WCX collects as fees. So for example if at the end of the month WCX fees are 40% in BTC, 30% in ETH, 15% in LTC, and 15% in XRP, you will be paid in those proportions as well.

Author: wcxofficial
Title: [ANN][ICO] WCX – Digital currency exchange built by ex Apple engineers
Body: Here are the rules for our Content Promotion:   Rules  - Your content must be original and high quality - no spam or unethical marketing - Your content must link to https://wcex.co - Your site or channel is popular or known in its niche. At least 1,000 followers for social media and video channels. - Your post must be longer than 80 words (if text) and longer than 20 seconds (if video) - Your post must be NEW. Please don't edit old posts to add WCX content.   Preferred Channels  - https://medium.com - https://steemit.com - https://reddit.com - https://youtube.com   Payouts  From 100 WCX to 2000 WCX depending on quality of your content and popularity of your site or channel. Payouts are made on Sundays.

Author: wcxofficial
Title: [ANN][ICO] WCX – Digital currency exchange built by ex Apple engineers
Body: We're based in Hong Kong. However, most positions we're hiring for are distributed around the world, particularly customer support. WCX is a truly global exchange - our focus is international. This can already be seen by the translation effort: the site and whitepaper are available in 3 dozen languages, there are a dozen or so local threads on BTalk, and WCX will be available in 20 languages on launch. Most traffic to the WCX site is from non-English speaking countries.  Concerning job openings, we'll have more information on this by next week.  Quote from: rofiq edan on August 10, 2017, 09:45:37 PM bagaimanakah cara mendapatkan pendapatan pasif dari WCX ?/      By buying and holding WCXT, you're entitled to a portion of WCX revenue payment made automatically to you on a monthly basis.  Quote from: gintrux on August 10, 2017, 09:54:18 PM Few more questions:  1. What exchanges will accept WCXT on 10.10.17, when everything launches? Any deals made already? 2. If referral system will be available only next week, how long will it be available? I mean until what date will it get turned off? ICO date?  1. WCXT will be traded on WCX after launch. We may list on other exchanges as well but no deal is currently sealed.  2. Likely till the end of the ICO. However this will depend on the amount of demand we see - we don't want to dilute WCXT since the dedicated marketing budget is 5% of all tokens.  Quote from: grou on August 10, 2017, 10:07:00 PM @wcxofficial  Me too, I finished the Georgian translation improvement.  the bounty will come to the same account I used for referral? should I contact you via email or here is fine?  thanks.  Please contact hello@wcex.co for translation bounties.

Author: Joking313
Title: [ANN][ICO] WCX – Digital currency exchange built by ex Apple engineers
Body: Since WCXT is technically a security how do you plan on dealing with SEC regulations for US investors?

Author: gintrux
Title: [ANN][ICO] WCX – Digital currency exchange built by ex Apple engineers
Body: 1. Why can't you make referral system sooner? It was already implemented, so no code changes are needed. If your website can handle normal traffic, it can handle referral traffic.  2. What is the starting price per WCXT token after ICO, when you launch?  3. Will it be possible to receive a private key of my wallet if I ask support?  4. What's the minimum WCXT amount needed to have in order to receive monthly revenue share?

Author: wcxofficial
Title: [ANN][ICO] WCX – Digital currency exchange built by ex Apple engineers
Body: This is TBD.  Quote from: gintrux on August 10, 2017, 11:32:20 PM 1. Why can't you make referral system sooner? It was already implemented, so no code changes are needed. If your website can handle normal traffic, it can handle referral traffic.  2. What is the starting price per WCXT token after ICO, when you launch?  3. Will it be possible to receive a private key of my wallet if I ask support?  4. What's the minimum WCXT amount needed to have in order to receive monthly revenue share?  1. We can, but we are trying to curb growth until we have the resources to handle it this early on. By next week we should be good to go.  2. 10 WCXT = 1 USD  3. This will be possible in Q3 2018 when customers will have the option to control their private keys while trading (decentralizing exchange wallets).  4. There will be a minimum although this hasn't been determined yet. The minimum is enforced for administration and payment reasons and to prevent spam wallets (e.g. to prevent one person from creating thousands of different addresses or accounts with 0.001 WCXT each).

Author: gintrux
Title: [ANN][ICO] WCX – Digital currency exchange built by ex Apple engineers
Body: Don't add Facebook login, most crypto users don't want to reveal their identity, FB is a little too much for most of them, including me.  I think solvemedia image captcha might be more legit than recaptcha, because recaptcha is usually 1 click - wait a second - and you are good to go. With image captcha, you need to type characters to prove you are legit.  Also, I think recaptcha does not work in countries that have internet censorship. China has blocked Google, recaptcha makes requests to Google servers, which are blocked, so it can't work. Russia, Iran, Syria, Pakistan, Sudan, some Arab countries are also restricting Google, so not sure if they can sign up.

Author: wcxofficial
Title: [ANN][ICO] WCX – Digital currency exchange built by ex Apple engineers
Body: ex-Apple. Core members are full-time, they don't work at other companies at the same time.  Referral program was suspended because demand was much stronger than we expected this early. Will be brought back likely by end of next week.  Concerning WCXT questions, the tokens will trade on WCX itself, potentially other exchanges post-launch. We don't have a price target - this is not something we set. However a basic cash flow analysis should make WCX price projections fairly straightforward because the main utility of WCXT is a tracker of WCX's profit, e.g. the more volume is expected on WCX the higher the price of WCXT.  The coin cap will likely remain hidden. Burned tokens apply to everyone equally, not just the public tokens. So if e.g. 80% of available tokens are sold by the end of the ICO, 20% are burned from the founder and advisor pile as well, it applies equally to all pieces of the pie.

Author: JoshuaT
Title: [ANN][ICO] WCX – Digital currency exchange built by ex Apple engineers
Body: "Also, what is with all the FUD.  Your dumb FUD is doing a disservice to all of us holding WCX"    LOL.  It's not FUD.  It's asking valid questions about a project/investment.  Your polyanna white knighting is out of place and a disservice to WCX and credible investors alike.  "So stop being impatient and unless you have PROOF of any wrongdoing I suggest you eat a bloody hat."  I'm not impatient.  I'm asking questions that have ongoingly not been answered (that may or may not in the future) except by you how thinks that unbacked claims are proofs.    Also I'm not accusing anybody of anybody of any wrongdoing, so I'm curious why your panties are in such a bunch.   "Please explain how the fraud will work if 1) presales have escrow 2) exchange is launching BEFORE public ICO."   You claimed no fraud was possible, which is a laughable, impossible claim.  Also, what escrow?  With who?  What are the terms of said escrow?  They -said- it's in escrow, no evidence. I'm not saying they're doing anything wrong, I'm saying they're making unbacked claims and that doesn't lend towards trust etc.   "Tell me you know who Poloniex founders are?"  I don't. But you're saying that if I did, I could go mug one of them and get all the monies.  WHICH IS A HORRIBLE SECURITY FLAW you seem to be ignoring while claiming to be a security pro.  No back up systems?  No two man rule (or more) for accessing funds??   The daily function of the exchange doesn't require those 'anonymous' people do be around and/or accessing the system, etc?    It would be great if you could drop the insults, it kills your credibility and is a toxic element on this forum.

Author: darkistorrik
Title: [ANN][ICO] WCX – Digital currency exchange built by ex Apple engineers
Body: I advise you to wait for the finished product, at least the test version. The fact that the developers do not open wild data (even just photos of the office with coin symbols) is very disappointing. Developers, I ask you to take a photo-video of your office, place of work, it will not be able to disclose your personal data in any way, but it will greatly increase the level of trust. As I now see the situation, this can be a great project or a fraud (you have well advertised your activity, and now you have launched a preliminary purchase and nothing hinders you before the release of the test version, just a chasm with the money received on the initial purchase). Author: byt411
Title: [ANN][ICO] WCX – Digital currency exchange built by ex Apple engineers
Body: Elaborating on this.  Bitcoin transactions are confirmed by miners, and no exchange has the capability of processing or confirming any transaction. There is no distributed server that can confirm transactions either. There is no way any exchange platform can 'reduce the global backlog'.  Deposits and withdrawals are handled by the bitcoin network, and confirmed by miners. Trades are handled internally on the platform by the trading engine.

Author: polkacoin
Title: [ANN][ICO] WCX – Digital currency exchange built by ex Apple engineers
Body: Already answered this in previous posts.  pros = no security risk, anonymous private key holders mean your funds won't be targeted by potential kidnappings, threats against private key holders, etc.  How exactly does revealing identities help you in any way.  How did that help all the people who had money on Mt Gox? All the owners were known and the exchange went under and bankrupt and people lost money.  How did that help Bitfinex when they got hacked for $200M? Again all the owners were known.  There's not much upside to revealing who holds the private keys, it's mostly all downside. This is understandable from security perspective (I work in bank IT security). I think it's very smart decision to keep it hidden if they decide to do so.  Sure let them reveal some team members but don't make public known to everyone who holds the private keys, that would be fucking stupid. Look at poloniex they are largest crypto exchange by volume and owners are not known!! And not one single security breach. It's a smart choice.  Second, as you trade on ANY exchange, don't keep funds there all the time, this is just common sense. It's not a wallet. you deposit, you trade, you withdraw. very low risk in this case and knowing private key holders makes very little difference.  Third, WCX is compliant according to whitepaper. That is easily verifiable when they launch and which countries they serve. That means due diligence, etc. has been made by many parties, perhaps even governments, vendors, etc. and owners were revealed to them. They are just not publicizing - again, smart decision I think.  Quote from: sud on August 05, 2017, 07:54:45 PM Where are they holding those priv keys? In their pockets? And someone will track and rob them? Lets be real please...  I just hope the devs will disclose the team before ICO starts like they promised.  Doesn't have to be in pocket, can be anywhere as long as location is known and that would make it a real risk. Also they will need access to cold storage from time to time to refill hot wallets I presume like every other exchange. So it's not gonna be in a mountain vault somewhere. Cryptocurrency is like a stash of cash.

Author: JoshuaT
Title: [ANN][ICO] WCX – Digital currency exchange built by ex Apple engineers
Body: Does poloniex, Kraken, and other big exchanges have secret unnamed officers/devs (leadership with access to private keys?) and no safetey/security protocols other than not publicly naming the leadership with access?  Like thieves couldn't easily figure that out? "Hmm, who's there that isn't publicly listed..."  You say poloniex owners are not known.  Are the owners the ONLY ones with access to funds?  Really?  (also, they look to be having solvency problems, so yeah, it's good to be unknown'.)  Or, is what you're telling us is that WCX, that wants to do daily volume of $1B and more, has no security/saftey system in place and just hopes that those few unnamed guys lurking around the office (that everybody that works there knows) don't get mugged (or have heart attacks) at which point WCX loses billions of dollars worth of coins?  That's a terrible, terrible system if that's what you're arguing for.

Author: polkacoin
Title: [ANN][ICO] WCX – Digital currency exchange built by ex Apple engineers
Body: Good so you agree they shouldn't reveal private key owners... It would indeed be fucking stupid. Yes Poloniex owners and leadership etc are not known, in fact nobody at Poloniex is known. I'm not saying WCX has to not reveal anyone, they can reveal parts of their team with no access to customer funds as I said in previous post...  BUT that needs to be controlled as well because bad actors with knowledge of team/residences of team members can use those to get to private key holders, which again puts customer funds in danger. WCX wants to go very big, global exchange, security should be at forefront of their priorities, from the start. If they wanna do it right and be a big player on the long term. Security is tough tough business WCX on the right path so far IMO.

Author: JoshuaT
Title: [ANN][ICO] WCX – Digital currency exchange built by ex Apple engineers
Body: "The WCX ICO will have a fixed hidden cap. 8% of tokens are reserved for the team and advisors; 5% are reserved for pre-ICO marketing and bounties; and 87% are reserved for sale during the ICO. Bonuses will be available for early buyers."  So....out of a mysterious X amount of total tokens, 8% are reserved for team and advisors, 5% are reserved for pre-ico marketing and bounties (that may or may not all get used up), and 87% are reserved for ICO sales.  1.  Where does the 15% bonus tokens for $25k purchasers come from?  The 87%?  2.  If only 20% of the 87% are sold during pre-ico and ico, then the 67% will get destroyed?  3.  They 'hidden cap' could be 15 billion coins, or 100 million coins.    If it's in the billions, then that 8% could be billions while the 20% that gets sold as the remaining total after the 67% get destroyed could only be in the tens/hundreds of millions.  4.  Is the token cap in the millions, or in the billions?

Author: JoshuaT
Title: [ANN][ICO] WCX – Digital currency exchange built by ex Apple engineers
Body: I'm guessing it's because A. it's a way to grow the userbase from the get-go.   It's better to start an exchange with as much volume as possible, as many people participating and giving good feedback to their social groups (hopefully it's good).  And because $.   They surely need to make bank, to buy coins, to have working coin capital for the buying/selling.  And because the more $ they raise, the more credible they look, the more new users will give it a try.  The faster they get to $1B in volume, the better, etc.  -IF- they can actually provide amazing and fast customer service, which from what they've said so far, they're not set up or ready for.

Author: JoshuaT
Title: [ANN][ICO] WCX – Digital currency exchange built by ex Apple engineers
Body: "All unsold tokens will be burned. The remaining supply will become the total supply of WCXT, in aggregate paying out 20% of WCX's fee revenue."   On the main site there's the calculator (how many coins gets one how much of the 20% at which volume level).  If WCX doesn't know how many tokens will exist after the ICO, how can it at all calculate the income from holding tokens?  The only real reason to purchase tokens is for the monthly income (somebody can show me why I'm wrong about that) because it's unlikely that on exchanges prices will wcxt will go up much if at all (because the only reason to hold tokens is for the monthly income (somebody can show me why I'm wrong about that)........  .....and if the calculated incomes are a lot less than what's on the calculator...then there's even less reason to purchase tokens.

Title: [ANN][ICO] WCX – Digital currency exchange built by ex Apple engineers
Body: Here is my best guess on the maximum number of tokens to be issued:  Assuming that they conduct the biggest campaign ever to raise money, that would give around $250 million, which leads to 2 500 000 000 tokens pre-ICO and ICO for 87% of the total tokens. Adding to that the missing 13%, that would give a maximum of 2 873 500 000 tokens.  If the project works, the token will raise because the profit made from each token will also raise. It can be compared to the price/earning ratio used everyday in the stock market.

Author: JoshuaT
Title: [ANN][ICO] WCX – Digital currency exchange built by ex Apple engineers
Body: 1.  Your math is wrong.   $250 million = 250millionx10 tokens (because $1=10 tokens).  2.  But let's go with it.  In general that math logic only works if the 8% and 5%  (really just the 8%)is based off the amount sold.  But It's not, it's (I'm 99% sure) based of the 'hidden cap', which could be 100 billion coins, or 10 billion, or 200 million, or...  Let's say the hidden cap is 10billion.  8% of that is 800 million.   Then if they sell 25 million tokens and burn the rest, that leaves 25mil in the hands of investors and 800 million in the hands of the team and advisors.  (In any case, how are they calculating the income per # of tokens per volume level?  I don't see how it can be at all accurate.)

Author: polkacoin
Title: [ANN][ICO] WCX – Digital currency exchange built by ex Apple engineers
Body: Are you new to bitcoin? It makes total sense to withhold some names, especially names of people who have access to private keys. In BTC/crypto is like having access to cash, so you can be target for kidnapping, theft, etc. That means revealing these IDs puts the WCX client funds at risk and also the safety of their staff. Many now in crypto who have revealed their identity are living with bodyguards 24/7 (coinbase, bitstamp CEOs, etc.) A billion dollar traditional CEO doesn't have to worry about that, their cash, company cash, etc. is held in bank. That being said they said they will reveal some name people, hopefully some with no access to private keys.  And concerning WCXT value seems very simple to me, it will go up when more volume on exchange, and down with less, because its fully correlated it pays out by based on volume, 20% of fee which is directly correlated to amount of volume on exchange.  And what ICO raise will be used for, its in whitepaper, read before making useless FUD!! Many of us now holding WCX token, buying pre-ICO etc. do not FUD without proof, you are making us a disservice. Here:  Funds raised at the ICO will be used for customer acquisition, research and development, and hiring the best and brightest in software development, security, marketing, compliance, and customer support.

Author: JoshuaT
Title: [ANN][ICO] WCX – Digital currency exchange built by ex Apple engineers
Body: Right, and CEO's and other public officers of massive corps don't have direct access to vast swaths of the company monies?    Are you new to the entire world of business?  WCX could just not say who holds the keys, in your argument.     Is it the CEO that holds them?   You're not going to name the CEO?  Because he holds the keys?  Really?  And just hope people believe you that the CEO is a worthwhile experienced pro that you can trust to lead the show?   RE:  price increase.   Volume has to increase A LOT to increase the stated payouts (the amounts of which are as of right now are just guesses blind guesses), and one has to have A LOT of tokens to get more payout.   And if the price is to go to $1, or $10, the payouts just aren't enough to justify spending, for instance, $20,000 to get $60 a month back in payouts IF volume gets to $1B.  Maybe it will trade up just on speculation on the price of the token itself, separate from actual value, like most coins in crypto right now.  We'll see.

Author: JoshuaT
Title: [ANN][ICO] WCX – Digital currency exchange built by ex Apple engineers
Body: Don't accuse me of FUD, this isn't chaincoin where the pumpers abuse anybody that raises questions.  "do not fud without proof" says the guy that's operating with faith in the face of zero proof (no named dev team or officers, 'hidden cap' on coin amounts, etc, etc).  Basic info that should be known before any investment.  Are you saying that you bought $25k worth of tokens just on faith and the unproveable claims of the whitepaper?  I'm asking questions in the face of a potential investment.  If you believe every unsubstantiated promise in a whitepaper, good luck to you.

Author: wcxofficial
Title: [ANN][ICO] WCX – Digital currency exchange built by ex Apple engineers
Body: The program will be back but we have no ETA. We had to suspend it for the time being due to much higher than expected demand. We were expecting 10,000 sign ups by now, we received 160,000.  Quote from: Lucasgabd on August 02, 2017, 05:04:42 PM Quote from: o48o on August 01, 2017, 09:28:04 PM From where i can check who excatly are in WCX dev team? Or are you planning to be anonymous?  I'd like to know the same.  We'll reveal team member identities over time. The issue here is security, which is a top priority for us. Revealing the identities of private key holders (e.g. directors) can put customer funds at risk as well as team members' personal safety, since that would put a target on their back.  Quote from: danijee on August 02, 2017, 02:27:07 PM great traction that you have gathered for the project have high expectations like all the others in this thread looking forward to the release of the whitepaper and further info about the project!  Whitepaper is expected to be released tomorrow. It'll contain more information about WCX, its competitive advantages, and why we're going after this market. It'll also have more details about the ICO and WCX token distribution.  WCX will have a fully functional product that you can use, before the ICO. So if you're planning on participating in the token sale, you'll know what you're getting into. This is in contrast to almost all ICOs who generally decide to raise money first and sell the promise of a product down the line.

Author: lawzeus
Title: [ANN][ICO] WCX – Digital currency exchange built by ex Apple engineers
Body: Excellent Idea - However the skeptic in me wonders the below   I would want to know more about the  a. Token Supply ( no whitepaper yet, what if the token supply is arbitrary and not capped ??) and  b. The Team (strange that nothing on the official website).  c. The website informs that "20% Profits" would be distributed amongst the token holders . Assuming if 1 Mil is the profit at the time the token holders are 100k and assuming the token holders increase from 100k to 500k in 5 years .then the 20% would be every decreasing (assuming the profits are not increasing at the rate the token holders are ). The policy is not equivalent of holding a finite number of shares in a limited liability company. Nor does it mimic the bond bearer instrument. (am confused)  d. How does the profit distribution happen ? are holders supposed to keep all WCX tokens in the exchange wallet ? or in the alternative are WCX token bearers in any wallet be rewarded . (reminds me of the exchange cryptopia) .  thanks

Author: identifyuser
Title: [ANN][ICO] WCX – Digital currency exchange built by ex Apple engineers

Author: polkacoin
Title: [ANN][ICO] WCX – Digital currency exchange built by ex Apple engineers
Body: That's not really true. 0 fees would make a lot of spam transaction, but WCX 0.1% fee is well enough to avoid this.

Author: Joking313
Title: [ANN][ICO] WCX – Digital currency exchange built by ex Apple engineers
Body: There are several ways around it, for instance you could put a cap on the number of transactions under $5.00 USD value per 24 hour period per account, make the minimum transaction amount $2.00,or more if need be.  People are clever and they will always find a way around the rules, so instead of fighting them it is best to try to cooperate with them, and allow bots with conditions if the network can not support the number of transactions happening at a time.  Otherwise the exchange will just get stuck in a never ending game of cat and mouse trying to chase away bot users.

Author: byt411
Title: [ANN][ICO] WCX – Digital currency exchange built by ex Apple engineers
Body: Not sure what you guys mean. There is no 'network' to be overloaded - WCX is not a decentralized exchange and trades are not made on-chain. Bots will also have to pay our commision like everybody else.

Author: Joking313
Title: [ANN][ICO] WCX – Digital currency exchange built by ex Apple engineers
Body: There is a network to be overloaded, it is the network that the server runs on, essentially bots will spam a large amount of tiny transactions, which requires a separate POST call for each transaction, many bots doing that at the same time will essentially cause an unintentional DDOS attack on the server's network, so it would be in their best interest to somehow limit the number of transactions these bots can perform in a certain time period,  of course this limit should be relative to the number of people and bots who use the website at a single time, and the capacity that the server can support

Author: darkistorrik
Title: [ANN][ICO] WCX – Digital currency exchange built by ex Apple engineers
Body: So, on the page №39 wcxofficial says that "Currently around 11% of those are still unverified emails, so potentially spam." Same page №42 "No, you won't receive a notification. Unfortunately notifying spam accounts will result in them changing up their tactics, which leads to more spam, which is counter-effective." In connection with the above, there was a question from Joking313 "Ok, is there a way though that i can verify to make sure that i haven't been flagged for spam, because i have gotten a good amount of referrals and i just want to make sure i wasn't accidentally flagged or that someone didn't misuse my link." Answer wcxofficial "Yes! You can reach out to hello@wcex.co and they can check that for you."  I became interested in this because at the moment I had 531 friends from whom I personally know about 420-460 (where I wrote a comment where I told in detail whom I invited), the rest is via social networks, etc. I wrote a letter hello@wcex.co. Answer - Hello, I don't have that information right now. It will be available at the end before the ICO. Best regards, Paul Kaplan Customer Support, WCX   So I want to know a few things: 1) On what basis will the team block accounts? (The technical side is described in detail), I am not satisfied with the statement that it is secret (describe in general terms, but in detail); 2) Why do different responses from company officials - wcxofficial (11% of unacknowledged letters for spam), hello@wcex.co (It is not possible to check for spam to the end); 3) It looks unfair for me - I have 531 friends, of which I can confirm about 460 (more precisely, they can do it themselves), if in the remaining 71 registered spam are found (just some kind of idiot spammed my link) then why will you block the account Immediately - i.e. Legally it is possible to confirm the overwhelming majority (that everything is honest), but what percentage of those registered can be generally spammed by a bad person whom I do not know and nobody knows (just a spammer on the network); 4) Why can not I check my account now? I because of the team's response about the impossibility of verification because of the uncertainty I will not invite anyone else (I wanted to pay through the official channels in social networks for advertising - there were about 1,000 friends left until the end). 5) Notifications are required before blocking - and if I want to challenge the lock, for example the situation as described above - though 460 people can send their photos and confirm their identity ... Now in my opinion it looks disgusting - the team does not notify about the blocking, does not say the verification technology (just that it is "unique"), the official response from the team of 2 different - on verification, impossibility of verification before the end (WTF), justify why it is not possible, nothing Prevents the team before the ICO to say to large accounts (with a large number of invited), then they are blocked without explaining anything ... How much I love this project, but all together looks like a fraud. I'm waiting for detailed, well-informed explanations from the official team!

Author: jaceefrost
Title: [ANN][ICO] WCX – Digital currency exchange built by ex Apple engineers
Body: Signup bounties only. All bounty is available in OP.  btw, I forgot to mention I didn't received the email verification and so my account still appears to be unverified.  I forgot to send a support email about this. I've checked spam and it's not there either.

Author: wcxofficial
Title: [ANN][ICO] WCX – Digital currency exchange built by ex Apple engineers
Body: 1) Spam emails are a minority. As long as your referrals aren't from pay-to-click sites, task workers, automation, etc. you're fine.  2) 11% of emails are unverified. That does not necessarily mean they are spam, we were just putting that figure out there. Some of those could be spam. Vice versa, some of the verified emails can be spam too. We won't notify spam accounts because that would cause them to change their spam tactics which would be counter-productive.  3) Spam is not the same as unverified. Unverified simply means the person did not yet click on the verification email link.  4) As a referrer, you're fine. If your link is shared through spam methods as described in the site footer, the people that are referred through those methods are tagged. Your account is not.   Quote from: jaceefrost on August 01, 2017, 05:59:51 AM Quote from: Lucasgabd on August 01, 2017, 04:17:11 AM Any bounty for twitter? Rt's. Etc? How to be sure that my refferal Link is working? Signup bounties only. All bounty is available in OP.  btw, I forgot to mention I didn't received the email verification and so my account still appears to be unverified.  I forgot to send a support email about this. I've checked spam and it's not there either.  Please reach out to hello@wcex.co for assistance!

Author: JoshuaT
Title: [ANN][ICO] WCX – Digital currency exchange built by ex Apple engineers
Body: I'm glad you're hiring more.  You'll need more.  A lot more.  The big complaint vs. exchanges is slow/crappy customer service.  I hope the whitepaper lays out how you're going to overhire so you'll be more than ready for awesome and fast customer service during growth.   5. This information will be released over time. Since this is a private key based business, it may be wise to keep some identities anonymous in the interest of security of customer funds and member personal safety.  I'll await the whitepaper.  Not naming names is a credibility killer.    6. The market is currently around $3B per day in trading volume. Forex for example is $5T per day. That's a 1000x opportunity for growth. We think we're just getting started.  Forex isn't comparable, I'm a little concerned you're using that as a basis for growth/volume predictions/expectations.  I'll wait for the whitepaper and hope it lays out how you're going to beat the other active exchanges and grow larger than the current #1 volume exchange.  How exactly are you going to grow to $1b/day volume?

Author: RobZorba
Title: [ANN][ICO] WCX – Digital currency exchange built by ex Apple engineers
Body: Hi WCX team,  Well, congratulations on everything you are doing and I wish you and all shareholders (including myself) huge success.  As others have said, dimensioning a crypto currency platform to be capable of handling millions of transactions a second is a huge undertaking.  I have questions on this.  WCX will be trading BITCOIN, ETHERIUM and mostr other popular blockchain currencies.  Now, BITCOIN has some serious dimensioning problems in its own right.  The transaction history is never archived, so every BITCOIN gets bigger and bigger and slower and slower.  The press have reported backlogs in BITCOIN transactions amounting to more than 165,000 transactions with no confirmation, and it is growing, not getting less!  http://www.newsbtc.com/2017/05/12/bitcoin-network-backlog-grows-165000-unconfirmed-transactions/  My question are these:  when BITCOIN transactions are made on WCX, who will confirm the transaction and process the BITCOIN chain?  Will this be done by the WCX platform itself, or will the BITCOIN that are traded by WCX just join the ever growing global queue (and growing backlog) to be processed by a distributed server somewhere else?  And if WCX servers will be able to process the BITCOIN transactions directly, then is it possible that the WCX platform could also be used to process and reduce the global backlog?  And if so, how will WCX earn money by doing the work of other traders for them?  Thanks a lot, RobZorba

Author: wcxofficial
Title: [ANN][ICO] WCX – Digital currency exchange built by ex Apple engineers
Body: FX is a market example. There are many others. Take stock trading: $100B per day on Nasdaq (one exchange in one country). http://www.nasdaqtrader.com/Trader.aspx?id=DailyMarketSummary. We believe there is quite a bit of room for growth.  Concerning security, along with customer satisfaction, it's our top priority. We will heed the advice of the security people on our team.  Our customer support is scalable, and will scale based on demand. We'd like to get as many languages as possible on the team, up to Tier 4 if necessary.  More information in the whitepaper coming soon.

Author: JoshuaT
Title: [ANN][ICO] WCX – Digital currency exchange built by ex Apple engineers
Body: Sure FX is an example of a market.  And the Nasdaq is an example of a market.  The sizes of which have zero to do with the cryptocurrency market.  Meaning, the Nascaq doing $110B/day has ZERO relevence to WCEX's ability to do $1/day volume.  That Nasdaq does $100B/day in now way means that WCEX can grow to any particular amount.  I will look to the white paper and hope to see the plan/roadmap, and hope not to see "WCEX will grow to $2B/day volume because tons of people trade in the stock market every day."  That is not a valid justification for growth.   I'm not trying to be sassy, I'm just wanting to know, as a potential investor/participant, how WCEX plans to grow to $1B/day volume, as that's where the token dividends start being a little bit attractive.

Author: Commie
Title: [ANN][ICO] WCX – Digital currency exchange built by ex Apple engineers
Body: A question to devs. You say that inless users want do deal with fiat currencies (at later stage) no ID will be required. However, since 2013 (I think) US authorities (not SEC but something similar, sorry I can't remember exact governing body name) set certain rules that most crypto exchanges are obliging to, one of them is ID verification. If you study charges pressed against Mr. Vinnik this one comes first - running an unauthorised monetary exchange. I read an extensive article on the subject yesterday in my news feed and it was basically saying that if you provide ANY exchange services to US citizens you're obliged to comply with their rules, otherwise you might as well end up being arrested. Sure we can keep saying that digital currencies aren't money etc etc but it looks like this doesn't fly anymore in the eyes of US authorities (which are well known for trying to confiscate everything they can't control). So my question is - how are you guys planning to deal with the legal side of things from this point of view? Not revealing founders names (just an example) won't fly at ICO, going this way you'll end up in gray/black markets, not as an established 100% legal exchange.

Author: wcxofficial
Title: [ANN][ICO] WCX – Digital currency exchange built by ex Apple engineers
Body: WCX is not specifically targeting the US - it's a global exchange. That being said, WCX will comply will all laws and regulations of the jurisdictions that it serves, and in jurisdictions where those regulations are not entirely clear (digital currency regulation is still a work in progress in many part of the world), we'll proactively reach out for guidance. That may indeed mean refusing to serve or imposing trading limits for customers in certain jurisdictions.  In short, WCX is a fully ethical and compliant exchange. If you're planning on using WCX for money laundering, tax evasion, or any other sort of illegal activity, you're gonna have a bad time.  Also to keep in mind that if you're planning on using fiat later in 2018 when that integration is planned to go live, KYC will be required regardless of the jurisdiction you reside in.

Author: wcxofficial
Title: [ANN][ICO] WCX – Digital currency exchange built by ex Apple engineers
Body: Hi all. Rewards for Twitter follow, coin voting, content promotion, and ANN thread translations are being paid to your WCX account in the next couple of hours!      WCT will be available to trade after the ICO ends (likely within 7 days).  Quote from: JoshuaT on July 30, 2017, 05:08:32 PM Is WCEX going to create coins after the ICO?  Tokens for sale during ICO and then any remainders burnt....but is WCEX then going to create coins?  If so, will they act as tokens (and if so, wouldn't that lower the dividend value?)   No WCT will ever be created after the ICO. Unsold coins at the ICO are burned and whatever is left will be the total supply of WCT.

Author: wcxofficial
Title: [ANN][ICO] WCX – Digital currency exchange built by ex Apple engineers
Body: Thanks. These are TBD. Some of the above will be covered in more detail in the whitepaper set to be released by mid next week.  Concerning cap, the ICO will be a hard cap, so there will be a limited amount of tokens issued. Any unsold tokens will be burned. There will be no re-issue, so that is the only time WCX tokens will be created.  Concerning fund distribution, also TBD for exact figures, but founders & advisors will likely retain around 10%. The rest is bounties and token sale.  Bonuses will be available at the ICO, particularly for early buyers.

Author: darkistorrik
Title: [ANN][ICO] WCX – Digital currency exchange built by ex Apple engineers
Body: Russian translation of the site with errors - correct)!!! Logical errors are noted here (not the correct construction of sentences - they do not say that!), Actual errors (spelling errors in spelling), punctuation errors (missed prefixes), a number of errors (includes logical, paragraph and spelling errors), etc. I have experience - I was the editor of several sites. OШИБКA "WCX этo тoкeны cтaндapтa ERC20. Mы плaниpyeм пpoвeдeниe ICO нa 9&e ceнтябpя 2017 гoдa" Пpaвильный вapиaнт - WCX этo тoкeны cтaндapтa ERC20. Mы плaниpyeм пpoвeдeниe ICO нa дeвятoe ceнтябpя 2017 гoдa OШИБКA "B пepвyю oчepeдь выжны мнтepecы клиeнтoв." Пpaвильный вapиaнт - B пepвyю oчepeдь вaжны интepecы клиeнтoв. OШИБКA "Этo знaчит чтo" Пpaвильный вapиaнт - Этo знaчит, чтo OШИБКA (caмa фpaзa пocтpoeнa нe вepнo, oшибки в пaдeжax) "Этo знaчит чтo бoльшe дeнeг ocтaнeтcя нa Baшeм кoшeлькe." Пpaвильный вapиaнт - Этo oзнaчaeт, чтo бoльшe дeнeжныx cpeдcтв ocтaнyтcя нa Baшeм кoшeлькe. PЯД OШИБOК - "Бeзoпacнocть. 98% вcex cpeдcтв клинтoв пocтoяннo xpaнятcя в xoлoдныx xpaнилищax" (пpoблeмa в тoм, чтo 99% вcex пoльзoвaтeлeй нe знaют чтo тaкoe "xoлoднoe" xpaнeниe, бoлee пpaвильнo бyдeт дoбaвить pacшифpoвкy/пoяcнeниe) Пpaвильный вapиaнт - Бeзoпacнocть. 98% вcex cpeдcтв клиeнтoв пocтoяннo xpaнятcя в xoлoдныx xpaнилищax (бeз дocтyпa к ceти интepнeт, чтo oбecпeчивaeт им мaкcимaльнyю бeзoпacнocть oт взлoмa) OШИБКA "Пpoгpaммнoe ядpo нaшeй биpжы paзpaбoтaннo вeтepaнaми Уoлл&cтpит". Пpaвильный вapиaнт - Пpoгpaммнoe ядpo нaшeй биpжи paзpaбoтaнo вeтepaнaми Уoлл-cтpит ЛOГИЧECКAЯ OШИБКA (тaк нe гoвopят + oшибки в пocтpoeнии пpeдлoжeний) "B тeчeнии тpexлeтниx пoлeвыx иcпытaний мы дoбилиcь eгo paбoты c миллиoнaми тpaнзaкций в ceкyндy пpaктичecки c нyлeвыми зaдepжкaми." Пpaвильный вapиaнт - Пocлe тpёxлeтниx пpaктичecкиx иcпытaний мы дoбилиcь cтaбильнoй paбoты пpoгpaммнoгo ядpa c миллиoнaми тpaнзaкций в ceкyндy пpaктичecки c нyлeвыми зaдepжкaми. ЛOГИЧECКAЯ OШИБКA (тaк нe гoвopят + oшибки в пocтpoeнии пpeдлoжeний) "Paдикaльнo yлyчшeнный интepфeйc пoльзoвaтeля." Пpaвильный вapиaнт - Интepфeйc, coздaнный для Bac PЯД OШИБOК (фaктичecкиx, лoгичecкиx и пpoпyщeннaя бyквa в cлoвe) - "Oбъeдинeннaя мoщнaя пaнeль тopгoвыx инcтpyмeнтoв дaeт гибкий, быcpый и yдoбный дocтyп кo вceм фyнкциям WCX кaк нa дecктoпe, тaк и нa мoбильнoм ycтpoйcтвe." Пpaвильный вapиaнт - Oбъeдинeннaя, мoщнaя пaнeль тopгoвыx инcтpyмeнтoв, кoтopaя oбecпeчивaeт гибкий, быcтpый и yдoбный дocтyп кo вceм фyнкциям WCX кaк нa дecктoпe, тaк и нa мoбильнoм ycтpoйcтвe. OШИБКA - "Haчнитe тopгoвлю из любoй тoчки миpa & мы нe тpeбyeм ID вepификaцию Baшeй личнocти." Пpaвильный вapиaнт - Haчнитe тopгoвлю из любoй тoчки миpa - мы нe тpeбyeм ID вepификaцию Baшeй личнocти. PЯД OШИБOК (фaктичecкaя и лoгичecкaя) - "Пpoдвинyтыe типa opдepoв. Пpocтoтa paзмeщeния pынoчныx, лимитныx, cтoп-мapкeтныx, cтoп-лимитныx, cкoльзящиx и блoкoвыx opдepoв. Кoтopыe paбoтaют имeннo тaк, кaк Bы oжидaтe. C нeпpeвзoйдeннoй cкopocтью иcпoлнeния." Пpaвильный вapиaнт - Пpoдвинyтыe типы зaявoк (opдepoв). Пpocтoтa paзмeщeния pынoчныx, лимитныx, cтoп-мapкeтныx, cтoп-лимитныx, cкoльзящиx и блoкoвыx зaявoк (opдepoв). Кoтopыe paбoтaют имeннo тaк, кaк Bы oжидaeтe. C нeпpeвзoйдeннoй cкopocтью иcпoлнeния. PЯД OШИБOК - "Oбecпeчивaeт тopгoвoe взaимoдeйcтвиe нeпocpeдcтвeнo c WCX cpeдcтвaми REST, WebSocket, или FIX для выcoкoчacтoтнoгo тpeйдингa." Пpaвильный вapиaнт - Oбecпeчивaeт тopгoвoe взaимoдeйcтвиe нeпocpeдcтвeннo c WCX. Taкими cpeдcтвaми кaк REST, WebSocket, или FIX для выcoкoчacтoтнoгo тpeйдингa. OШИБКA - "Haшa кoмaндa & пpoфeccиoнaлы из Apple, Deutsche Bank, и IBM, имeющиe oгpoмный oпыт paзpaбoтки, пocтpoeния и coпpoвoждeния бeзoпacныx, pacпpeдeлeнныx кpyпнoмacштaбныx финaнcoвыx cиcтeм." Пpaвильный вapиaнт - Haшa кoмaндa — этo пpoфeccиoнaлы из Apple, Deutsche Bank, и IBM, имeющиe oгpoмный oпыт paзpaбoтки, пocтpoeния и coпpoвoждeния бeзoпacныx, pacпpeдeлeнныx кpyпнoмacштaбныx финaнcoвыx cиcтeм. If my work is marked (rewarded) I will be more than happy, if not, then I'm still happy to make WCX better.

Author: JoshuaT
Title: [ANN][ICO] WCX – Digital currency exchange built by ex Apple engineers
Body: 1. "No tokens will be generated beyond the ones sold at the ICO. Any unsold tokens will be burned. The tokens that remain will pay out 20% of the exchange fee revenue regardless of how many there are, so we won't cut back on that either."  Does that mean that the ICO is the ONLY time 'new' tokens will be generated?   So if, say, 100,000 tokens are sold at the ICO, everything else is destroyed, and the 100,000 is then THE TOTAL amount of existing tokens?  2.  Anonymous sign up (crypto, non-fiat) is awesome.  If you can keep it that way (due to gov't).   Are you sure you can operate with anonymous customer base?  3.  How is WCX responding to the US SEC's ruling that ICO's fall under (blah blah blah)?  4.  If your big selling point is great customer service, how many customer support reps do you have now, will you have later, and how are you training new hires?  5.  Where can I get more info on the governing body, meaning, board of directors and devs.  6.  Can we get an idea of the marketing strategy to take WCX to 1billion in volume?   Poloniex is currently #1 with 150million daily volume (as far as I can tell).  Sure the market is growing, but WCX is going to need to knock a few of the least competitive exchanges off the board (meaning that WCX needs to be the most competitive).  7.  Is this the same coin?  http://wcxcoin.com/   If not, how do you have the same name and what's the plan to avoid confusion?  8.  How many tokens/coins is WCX capped at?

Author: wcxofficial
Title: [ANN][ICO] WCX – Digital currency exchange built by ex Apple engineers
Body: 1. Correct.  2. Crypto will be anonymous. Fiat integration which is happening in 2018 will require KYC from customers if they want to deposit or withdraw fiat from/to a bank.  The regulatory landscape for digital currencies is still evolving. WCX will comply with all regulations that have been set out clearly. And we'll proactively reach out to jurisdictions where regulation is not clear, for guidance.  In short, WCX is an honest, ethical trading platform. If you try to use us for money laundering, tax evasion, or any other potentially criminal activity, you're gonna have a bad time.  3. We're studying this since it's a recent development. WCX is global and has attracted demand from 177 countries based on the sign ups we've received so far at wcex.co.  4. Our value proposition is: Tiny Fees + Incredible Service. We have great customer support reps and we're actually hiring more - we have around 30 positions open across many different languages. If you're interested, skilled, and have customer support experience, please drop us a line hello@wcex.co.  5. This information will be released over time. Since this is a private key based business, it may be wise to keep some identities anonymous in the interest of security of customer funds and member personal safety.  6. The market is currently around $3B per day in trading volume. Forex for example is $5T per day. That's a 1000x opportunity for growth. We think we're just getting started.  7. WCX Tokens symbol will be WCT when it hits exchanges, so no confusion there.  8. There is a hard cap on WCX tokens. Details are TBD.

Any time an exchange integrates fiat, KYC is required because banks require it.  Regarding competitive advantages, anonymity and global nature are certainly part of them, but mainly:  - Tiny Fees. - Incredible User Experience. - Awesome Customer Service.

Author: wcxofficial
Title: [ANN][ICO] WCX – Digital currency exchange built by ex Apple engineers
Body: The total crypto trading volume is around $3B per day. This figure is growing rapidly, but compared to other trading instruments, this figure is actually quite low.  Forex, for example, is estimated to have trading volume of around $5Trillion per day.  This leads us to strongly believe crypto trading volumes have a huge amount of room to grow. But before that can happen, the market requires one (or more) exchanges that can provide a great service coupled with low fees. That's where WCX comes in.

Author: dababe

Body: Well MOST exchanges require KYC for any transactions that touch fiat and do not require the same for crypto to crypto activities.  So the only real differentiator you have is low fees, right? Because privacy isn't one of the differentiators here. <smile>  You are "...still studying this." Hmmm... This is something you should be intimately familiar with at this time. It is critical and can make a difference as to whether you survive or not. If you are not familiar with the regulatory issues on a micro level, may I recommend you find someone who is? It is not a small consideration. It is not just the USA ... it is a global parameter. It is of HUGE concern.  All the best!  Thank you for your response.

Body: This is a bit misleading because you're cherry-picking some of the worst exchange rates of the popular exchanges. The current volume-leader, Bitfinex, only does a 0.1% maker and 0.2% taker fee. So yours is slightly better by 0.05% than the leading exchange.

Author: wcxofficial
Title: [ANN][ICO] WCX – Digital currency exchange built by ex Apple engineers
Body: Bitfinex charges both the maker and the taker. So the total fee is 0.3%.  WCX pays the maker +0.05% and charges the taker -0.15%. So the total fee is 0.1%. WCX is 200% cheaper.

Author: wcxofficial
Title: [ANN][ICO] WCX – Digital currency exchange built by ex Apple engineers
Body: Thank you all for your continued support. We're very excited and can't wait to introduce WCX to the world.   A note regarding spam  Please keep in mind: spamming your referral link is strictly prohibited and will result in account termination and loss of your WCX tokens.   What's "spamming"?  - Using ad viewing sites with your referral link - Any kind of automation, like scripting or use of bots, or buying unique link sign ups on sites like Fiverr, etc. - Creating Twitter accounts to share your link - Twitter blasts on spam / promo-only Twitter accounts - Posting your referral link multiple times in a row on Twitter or Facebook - Use of disposable emails - Any kind of duplicate registration - Any other kind of unethical marketing scheme   Also, please do not post your referral link in this thread. We'd like to keep this thread clean for constructive conversation and respect the rules of the forum.      Quote from: fratrad on July 27, 2017, 12:17:06 PM I can do translation into german.  Quote from: DraQ1 on July 27, 2017, 02:44:27 PM Hit me if You need polish translation.   I can run #WCX tag on polish reddit (Wykop). Quote from: darkistorrik on July 27, 2017, 01:00:11 PM Good afternoon. I think that in a week, maybe two, I'll get 500 subscribers and get 50,000. After this moment - 50,000 is the maximum or can I invite friends and get more than 50,000? If the maximum, then how can you get more? Is there a purse in windows? Please keep in mind to follow the rules laid out above about spam for your referrals to count.

Title: [ANN][ICO] WCX – Digital currency exchange built by ex Apple engineers
Body: New Promotion Bounties   Get paid in WCX tokens when you publish high quality material about WCX on your blog, website, Youtube channel, or email list. Now accepting all languages.   Rules  - Your content must be original and high quality - no spam or unethical marketing - Your content must link to https://wcex.co - Your site or channel is popular or known in its niche. At least 1,000 followers for social media and video channels. - Your post must be longer than 80 words (if text) and longer than 20 seconds (if video)   Preferred Channels  - https://medium.com - https://steemit.com - https://reddit.com - https://youtube.com   Payouts  From 100 WCX to 2000 WCX depending on quality of your content and popularity of your site or channel. Payouts are made on a weekly basis.   Complete this form after you publish your content to receive a payout.

Title: [ANN][ICO] WCX – Digital currency exchange built by ex Apple engineers

Quote from: Steelfox7 on July 26, 2017, 11:19:56 PM Does the team plan on remaining anonymous or will there be at least one or two who will be the "face" of this token (Similar to Vitalik with Ethereum)?  We'll be revealing more information in the days and weeks to come. Security of customer funds and private keys is paramount here – revealing identities of private key (partial) holders may put the security of customer funds and their personal safety at risk in the long run.

Author: Steelfox7
Title: [ANN][ICO] WCX – Digital currency exchange built by ex Apple engineers
Body: The one dividend token I am familiar with is DICE. With this token, the users can store the tokens on an ethereum address in which they control the private key. To receive the dividend, they interact with the smart contract once a quarter and dividend is sent to the address.  With WCX tokens, will we be able to store this token on ETH address we control or will we have to store on the exchange to receive the dividend?  I would like to be able to store the tokens on my own Eth address if possible.  Will dividend payment be passive or will we have to interact with a smart contract once a week to receive payment?  Thanks again for your explanations - I am trying to visualize how users will interact with this token.

Author: wcxofficial
Title: [ANN][ICO] WCX – Digital currency exchange built by ex Apple engineers
Body: You'll be able to store WCX on your own ETH address / wallet, of course. You can also store it on WCX. If you choose to store it on your own address, you'll enter your address on your WCX account so we can effectively calculate your payout based on your share of the total amount of tokens.  Payment will be made to your WCX wallet automatically on a weekly basis. You'll receive payment not just in ETH, but in all sorts of digital currencies because the exchange generates fees in all the currencies that are offered for trading. That's why we like to say that holding WCX tokens is equivalent to holding an income portfolio of diverse digital currencies.

Author: Mcc3
Title: [ANN][ICO] WCX – Digital currency exchange built by ex Apple engineers
Body: I think the lower fees are nice, and will no doubt be appreciated, but I think the way you guys can 100% standout, is your "awesome customer service" as I believe you put it.  By far the biggest complaint I hear from people in the Crypto world is anytime they have a problem, with a deposit, withdrawal, etc it takes Bittrex, Poloniex, etc sometimes 2-3 weeks to get back to them.  I recently had a problem with a deposit that easily could have been solved in about 2 minutes, and took almost 3 weeks to fix.    I think pushing or even guaranteeing something along the lines of, "You will have an actual rep look and address your problem with in 12 hours, guaranteed"   Would go a LONGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGG way in people giving this site a chance.  Just my two cents though, but already refereed a bunch of people, like the looks and will be buying some in the ICO, so hoping for the best!

Author: wcxofficial
Title: [ANN][ICO] WCX – Digital currency exchange built by ex Apple engineers
Body: Hello all.  Reminder: the Sign Up bonus for https://wcex.co will decrease to 50 WCX and the friends referral reward will decrease to 100 WCX per friend in the next hour, as mentioned earlier. If your WCX balance changes during this time, don't worry as it will be back to its original value soon.  Our answers below for recent replies:      Yes! We'll be contacting translators soon.   Quote from: Joking313 on July 26, 2017, 08:39:37 PM Just a suggestion maybe get a .com domain instead of a .co domain, would make the company seem more legit  Working on it. No promises - 4-letter .com domains are tough to get.   Quote from: Steelfox7 on July 26, 2017, 09:00:49 PM Are you guys still giving out tokens for following on twitter and voting for the coin?  I did both of these 7/26 without checking to see if the offer was still valid.  These will be paid out on 7/30 as indicated in the original post.   Quote from: Oliver DelaBean on July 26, 2017, 09:08:56 PM is it spamming when im refering my followers on twitter, facebook and other chats? its not possible that i have only one referrer  please fix it, im not a spammer at all, best regards Oliver  Please contact hello@wcex.co if you're having trouble with sign in or sign up. Please keep in mind the rules to sign up and receive your tokens:  - you're using a real email, and not using a disposable email service to register  - you're not double registering with the same IP  - you're not signing up through a spam referrer, e.g. through advertising software, ad viewing sites, automation, automated clicks, scripting, etc.  These are spam prevention measures. There are likely more than a few spammers, duplicates, disposable emails, etc. who have signed up over the last few days to take advantage of the free tokens. We'll be working on identifying and disabling them over the next few days. It's a real counter.

Author: wcxofficial
Title: [ANN][ICO] WCX – Digital currency exchange built by ex Apple engineers
Body: Thanks all for your continued support. We're so excited about WCX and can't wait to bring it to you.   The best way to stay in the loop on our progress, timelines, ICO, launch, and more, is to:  > Register at https://wcex.co;  > Follow WCX on Twitter;  > Follow this thread.        Hey Glory90. Sorry to hear about the verification email. Please contact hello@wcex.co (using the email you used to sign up) for assistance.  Regarding withdrawals, there will be no time delays. Regarding Facebook, we are likely to start managing a page soon, but for now we wanted to focus efforts on Twitter where we think we'll be able to reach cryptocurrency traders more efficiently.    Quote from: Alex_Zi on July 26, 2017, 10:06:57 AM I have joined! Thanks for 100WCX. Can I sell it before start project on another exchange? - Don't answer - i find the question. Will it be some bounty campaign before and during ICO?  Yes. Bounty campaigns will likely continue till WCX launch on October 10, 2017.    Quote from: DaCash on July 26, 2017, 11:47:44 AM Can you confirm that payouts will be in different currencies directly to WCX wallets for every participant, without any conversion thru ETH? I stayed away from other exchange ICO because of exactly that - payouts going via ETH. Also what is the payout scheme - daily, or smth like quarterly mimicking typical divident schemes? Thanks!  That's correct. Payouts will be made to your WCX wallet in all the types of digital currencies WCX supports. There is no conversion through ETH.  Payouts will be made on a weekly basis. More information about WCX tokens is available in our original post and on WCX.    Quote from: hola2011 on July 26, 2017, 12:59:46 PM Hello dev team,  Will there be mobile apps for both android and ios (wallet, trading platform, etc)?  These are for people who are always on the go, it would be more convenient to trade/exchange from the smart phone anytime, anywhere, yes?   Yes. Mobile apps are on our roadmap for early 2018 for both iOS and Android.    Quote from: anfisa75 on July 26, 2017, 01:01:57 PM If I advertise on social networks, the laws of my referrals?  You can share your referral link anywhere you want as long as you don't spam. E.g. advertising software, ad viewing sites, automation, scripting, Twitter blasts, unethical marketing schemes, disposable emails, etc. Spam signups will be removed and their accounts terminated, as well as the referred user rewards obtained for those accounts.    Quote from: kabit9 on July 26, 2017, 01:32:37 PM already made recommendations on the appropriate form but thought I will list here too the suggested cryptos to be traded on launch:  - BTC - ETH - XMR - LTC - XRP - USD-T - FCT - SC - GOL - DASH - POT - ANS   Added POT, LSK, DCR, Europecoin to the coin voting form here: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdkFM1HKmTfhDeJ5Acn5hstJFi_Mcj8KIgMk7fpvOxJ2Ua5aA/viewform?usp=sf_link    Quote from: taeewo on July 26, 2017, 01:49:47 PM Would there be a strict verification process before someone can trade  No - there is no ID verification when you trade cryptocurrencies.

Author: wcxofficial
Title: [ANN][ICO] WCX – Digital currency exchange built by ex Apple engineers
Body: Hello,  Regarding sign up or sign in issues at https://wcex.co  If you're seeing an error when signing up such as "Referrer was banned for spam" or "Account not found" or "Account already used", please make sure:  - you're using a real email, and not using a disposable email service to register  - you're not double registering with the same IP  - you're not signing up through a spam referrer, e.g. through advertising software, ad viewing sites, automation, automated clicks, scripting, etc.  These are spam prevention measures. For other issues, please email hello@wcex.co and we'll be happy to assist you!   Also: if you have "." in your email username, try signing in without the ".". E.g. if it's john.smith@gmail.com, try johnsmith@gmail.com.   We're seeing an inordinate amount of traffic and sign ups – the sign up form should handle this and scale without issue. You can track signed up users in real-time on the front page of https://wcex.co where it says "33,810 people have signed up for WCX."

Author: evergrow
Title: [ANN][ICO] WCX – Digital currency exchange built by ex Apple engineers
Body: To keep things on topic here's a recap of all the answers @wcxofficial has already given. Got to study the answers in order not to ask the same over and over again.       Quote from: wcxofficial on July 25, 2017, 02:50:43 AM Thanks again for your replies and questions. Please find our answers below.  (Here's a link to our previous answer wiki: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=2026078.msg20340135#msg20340135)  I can't wait to read the whitepaper. When it will be available?  This will become available within the next couple of weeks. More information about the ICO fund distribution, team, etc. will also be made available.  What currencies can be used to purchase WCX tokens during the ICO?  BTC and ETH. If there's enough interest we can accommodate for other currencies as well.  Are there deposit or withdrawal limits?  No.  Will you have a chatbox?  Yes.  Is it a decentralized exchange?  No, not at first. Decentralization of user wallets is on our roadmap for 2018.  How will you compete with incumbent exchanges?  Considerably lower fees, awesome customer service, and radically better user experience.  What will happen after the ICO with unsold tokens?  Unsold tokens will be burned.  If you invite more than 250 people using the referral system at https://wcex.co, will they be counted?  Yes. There is no limit to how many people you can invite. 250 is the max shown on the progress bar, but your balance will keep increasing if you refer more.  Where will WCX tokens be traded?  They will be traded on WCX with bases BTC, ETH, and USDT.  Can we withdraw the WCX tokens from our account?  Not yet. WCX token is an ERC20 token so you'll be able to withdraw it to your Ethereum wallet.  How will the commissions be paid to WCX token holders if they're held in an Ethereum wallet?  Payments will be made to your WCX wallet. You'll be getting paid in all sorts of digital currencies, since WCX collects fees in many different digital currencies. If your WCX tokens are held outside of WCX itself, you'll be able to provide an ETH address on your account that we'll monitor when making payments to you.  Will you offer derivatives at launch time?  No. Margin trading is on the roadmap for 2018.  Please add BNT, OMG, MYST, TAAS, PLBT.  These have been added to the voting form here: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdkFM1HKmTfhDeJ5Acn5hstJFi_Mcj8KIgMk7fpvOxJ2Ua5aA/viewform?usp=sf_link  Please let us know by replying in this thread if there are coins you'd like to trade that are not listed on the voting form.  Do WCX tokens give me voting rights concerning decisions made for the exchange?  Decisions on which coins and markets to add next will be made based on public interest and voting.  Will the ICO announcement such as date and so on be posted on this thread, or will it be on another thread on the ANN subforum?  We'll notify users on this thread, Twitter, and through email if you registered at https://wcex.co.  If a friend of mine invites another friend, will I benefit?  No. You'll get credited for the first level of friends you invite (not multi-level).     Quote from: wcxofficial on July 25, 2017, 11:44:34 PM Thanks again for your replies and questions. Please see our answers below.  Our previous answer wikis, where we answer frequently asked questions, are available here:  https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=2026078.msg20340135#msg20340135 https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=2026078.msg20362180#msg20362180   How long will the referral program be active for?  It'll likely be active till the Beta launch in early September. The rewards will decrease over time. The sign up bonus promotion is likely to decrease from 100 WCX to 50 WCX in the next 24 hours, and the referrals will decrease from 200 WCX to 100 WCX per friend.  Added QTUM, WINGS, STORJ, MINEREUM, STEEM, ANT, BYTE, XZT, BCC to the Coin voting form.  You can find a list of coins we’re considering here: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdkFM1HKmTfhDeJ5Acn5hstJFi_Mcj8KIgMk7fpvOxJ2Ua5aA/viewform. You can suggest other coins to add by replying in this thread.  How will the revenue sharing process work with WCX tokens?  Payments will be made to your WCX wallet. You'll be getting paid in all sorts of digital currencies, since WCX collects fees in many different digital currencies. If your WCX tokens are held outside of WCX itself, you'll be able to provide an ETH address on your account that we'll monitor when making payments to you.  How does the referral system count referrals?  Referred users need to verify their email for them to count.  I'm getting an “Account already in use.” error when trying to sign up at https://wcex.co.  This means your IP has already been used. It’s one registration per IP.  Is there a minimum of WCX needed to receive revenue share payments?  Yes, although this hasn't yet been determined. It'll be low - the measure is simply taken to avoid blockchain spam.  Plans to list on other exchanges outside of WCX?  Not at this time. Liquidity to buy or sell will be available on WCX for WCX tokens at launch time.  How to participate in the Beta launch?  We'll be looking for beta users. This will be communicated in this thread, on Twitter (@wcxofficial), and by email (the one you used to register at https://wcex.co).  Will you support BCC?  We'll support all coins with enough interest from the public, measured mainly through voting/polling.  Very nice to see everything answered. A good job!
